response.hint: The image is not suitable for authentication and onboarding checks. Please ensure the photo is a clear, passport-style image with a plain background, good lighting, and no accessories like sunglasses.
response.rationale: The image does not meet the requirements for a passport-style photo. The person is wearing sunglasses, and the background is not plain.

A Task Forwarder will receive the output of a Task and forward it to the specified destination. This can be used to send data to external systems, or to trigger other actions based on the output of a Task.

Response 403 List Available Models Org  Org Id  Project  Project Id  Model Get

body.name: gpt-3.5-turbo
body.description: A fast and cost-effective model for a broad range of tasks. 16K context window with training cut off of Sep 2021.

body.name: gpt-4
body.description: The fourth-generation model with advanced reasoning and understanding. 8k context window with training cut off of Sep 2021.

body.name: gpt-4-turbo
body.description: The latest GPT-4 Turbo model with vision capabilities. 128K context window with training cut off of Dec 2023.

body.name: gpt-4-turbo-preview
body.description: GPT-4 Turbo preview model featuring improved instruction following, JSON mode. 128K context window with training cut off of April 2023. Returns a maximum of 4,096 output tokens. This is a preview model.

body.name: gpt-4o
body.description: GPT-4o ("o" for "omni") is OpenAI's most advanced model. It is multimodal, it has the same high intelligence as GPT-4 Turbo but is much more efficient â€” it generates text 2x faster and is 50% cheaper.

body.name: claude-3-5-sonnet-20240620
body.description: Anthropics most intelligent model. 200K context window with 4k max output with training cut off of June 2024.

body.name: claude-3-haiku-20240307
body.description: Anthropics fastest and most compact model. 200K context window with 4k max output with training cut off of Aug 2023.

body.name: claude-3-sonnet-20240229
body.description: Balanced model between intelligence and speed. 200K context window with 4k max output with training cut off of Aug 2023.

body.name: claude-3-opus-20240229
body.description: Anthropics most powerful model. 200K context window with 4k max output with training cut off of Aug 2023.

body.name: gemini-1.5-pro-latest
body.description: Googles latest gemini model. 100K context window and 8k max output with training cut off in late 2023.

body.name: gemini-pro
body.description: Googles 1.0 version gemini model. 30K context window and 2k max output with training cut off in late 2023.

schema.title: Response List Available Guardrails Org  Org Id  Project  Project Id  Guardrail Get

task_input.title: Task Input
task_input.description: The data input to the Task. This should be relevant to the `user_prompt` and cover any dynamic `{...}` parameters that are referenced in the prompt. Not required if `image_required` is set to `true` and there are no dynamic parameters in the prompt.

task_file.title: Task File
task_file.description: Image file to be provided to the LLM, only required when `image_required` is set to `true`.

chat_guardrails.description: Conversational Guardrails can be defined to run against Chat `input` (i.e. the users query) or on Chat `output` (i.e. the LLM output)

query_expansion.title: Query Expansion
query_expansion.description: Enable query expansion. Uses an LLM to generate multiple rephrasing of the original query for better broad spectrum vector retrieval

chat_guardrails.description: Conversational Guardrails can be defined to run against Chat `input` (i.e. the users query) or on Chat `output` (i.e. the LLM output)

query_expansion.title: Query Expansion
query_expansion.description: Enable query expansion. Uses an LLM to generate multiple rephrasing of the original query for better broad spectrum vector retrieval

add.title: Add
add.description:
A list of chat roles to grant to the member.

Roles in this list are applied to the member AFTER any removals specified in `remove`.

This may be combined with `remove_all` to replace the member's entire role list.

remove.title: Remove
remove.description: A list of chat roles to revoke from the member.

remove_all.title: Remove All
remove_all.description: Removes all existing roles from the member. This may be combined with `add` to replace all existing roles that the member holds.

permissions.title: Permissions
permissions.description: A list of permissions to test on the chat.

alias.title: Alias
alias.description: Human readable name for the LLM.

provider.title: Provider
provider.description: The company that produces the LLM.

supports_vision.title: Supports Vision
supports_vision.description: Whether the LLM is able to see and interpret images.

A list of collection roles to grant to the member.

input.title: Input

output.title: Output

add.title: Add
add.description:
A list of document roles to grant to the member.

Roles in this list are applied to the member AFTER any removals specified in `remove`.

This may be combined with `remove_all` to replace the member's entire role list.

remove.title: Remove
remove.description: A list of document roles to revoke from the member.

remove_all.title: Remove All
remove_all.description: Removes all existing roles from the member. This may be combined with `add` to replace all existing roles that the member holds.

permissions.title: Permissions
permissions.description: A list of permissions to test on the document.

member.title: Member
member.description: The member identifier string, the format of which is '<subject_type>:<subject_id>'

roles.title: Roles
roles.description:
A list of roles that the member holds on an entity.

Some entities, such as Organizations, may contain members that exist without any roles.

avatar_url.title: Avatar Url
avatar_url.description: If avatar of the member, if it is supported by their subject type.

total_subjects.title: Total Subjects
total_subjects.description: The total number of subjects that the member represents, which may be a value other than `1` if the member is not a User.

pagination.description: Contains pagination information for the result set.

results.title: Results
results.description: The list of items returned for the current page.

pagination.description: Contains pagination information for the result set.

results.title: Results
results.description: The list of items returned for the current page.

pagination.description: Contains pagination information for the result set.

results.title: Results
results.description: The list of items returned for the current page.

next_cursor.title: Next Cursor
next_cursor.description: A token used to retrieve the next page of results. If `null`, there are no more results.

has_next.title: Has Next
has_next.description: Indicates whether there are more results available in the next page.

page_limit.title: Page Limit
page_limit.description: The maximum number of items returned per page.

message.title: Message
message.description: Human readable representation of the error

permissionCheckFailedError.description: Metadata detailing more information about the error.

query_expansion.title: Query Expansion
query_expansion.description: Enable query expansion. Uses an LLM to generate multiple rephrasing of the original query for better broad spectrum vector retrieval

query_expansion.title: Query Expansion
query_expansion.description: Enable query expansion. Uses an LLM to generate multiple rephrasing of the original query for better broad spectrum vector retrieval

add.title: Add
add.description:
A list of project roles to grant to the member.

Roles in this list are applied to the member AFTER any removals specified in `remove`.

This may be combined with `remove_all` to replace the member's entire role list.

remove.title: Remove
remove.description: A list of project roles to revoke from the member.

remove_all.title: Remove All
remove_all.description: Removes all existing roles from the member. This may be combined with `add` to replace all existing roles that the member holds.

permissions.title: Permissions
permissions.description: A list of permissions to test on the project.

name.title: Name
name.description: A name or reference for the Task.

description.title: Description
description.description: A longer description of the Task for internal reference.

enabled.title: Enabled
enabled.description: When `true` the Task is active and callable. `false` denotes the Task is not yet operational.

id.title: Id
id.description: The unique identifier of the Task.

project_id.title: Project Id
project_id.description: The Project that the Task belongs to.

modified.title: Modified
modified.description: When the Task was last updated.

revisions.title: Revisions
revisions.description: Each update to a Task results in a new Revision being created. Task Revisions are a powerful concept that can be used to assist with A/B testing, comparing responses from different LLM's, etc.

example.description: A task to pre-triage user onboarding before IDV.
example.name: Fintech Pre-Triage

system_prompt.title: System Prompt
system_prompt.description: The system prompt that is used to set the LLM context.

user_prompt.title: User Prompt
user_prompt.description: The description of the Task. It is not required to mention the outputs in the prompt, but it can help the model to understand the context better. Any input strings should be referenced with the dynamic `{...}` syntax, this informs the model to look for those values in the input data.

llm_model.title: Llm Model
llm_model.description: The LLM model to use for the Task.

llm_config.description: Specific configuration parameters for the LLM model.

output_format.title: Output Format
output_format.description: This gives control over the structure of how the Task responds. Supports shorthand notation or an object with `type` can be specified for each attribute. In most instances, the LLM will be able to generate the desired output into the relevant property, but an optional `description` can be passed to provide it with additional context.

task_forwarder_id.title: Task Forwarder Id
task_forwarder_id.description: The unique identifier for a valid Task Forwarder. It is used to forward the Task output to another system or service.

rag.description: **Note: This is a Paid Tier feature.** Provide additional domain specific input to the LLM so that it is able to reference user specific information when executing the Task. Examples of this could be a product catalogue, terms and conditions or a user manual.

image_required.title: Image Required
image_required.description: When `true` it requires an image to be sent in the Task Run request.

name.title: Name
name.description: A name or reference for the Task.

description.title: Description
description.description: A longer description of the Task for internal reference.

enabled.title: Enabled
enabled.description: When `true` the Task is active and callable. `false` denotes the Task is not yet operational.

example.description: A task to pre-triage user onboarding before IDV.
example.name: Fintech Pre-Triage

match.description: True if the provided description is a close match

example.system_prompt: You are an expert software program specifically designed for the fintech industry that will be used for pre-triage tasks to ensure the best possible client UX and efficient 3rd party platform interoperability.
example.user_prompt: Your task is to validate the uploaded image and determine whether it will be suitable for authentication and onboarding checks. If the image of the person is clear and typical of a passport style photo then set the compliance field to true. Provide rationale for your decision in the rationale field. If the compliance result is false, then provide a helpful hint for the customer who has submitted the photo informing them why it is unacceptable and some steps to remedy it, place this into the hint field. Determine whether the following description matches the provided image: {description}

name.title: Name
name.description: A descriptive name for the Task Forwarder.

description.title: Description
description.description: Additional details about the Task Forwarder's purpose or configuration.

config.description: Configuration parameters for the Task Forwarder such as a `destination` URL.

config_sensitive.description: Sensitive parameters for the Task Forwarder such as a `signing_key`.

id.title: Id
id.description: The unique identifier of the Task Forwarder.

project_id.title: Project Id
project_id.description: The Project that the Task Forwarder belongs to.

created.title: Created
created.description: When the Task Forwarder was created.

modified.title: Modified
modified.description: When the Task Forwarder was last updated.

example.description: Send all Task output to this API endpoint to ensure real-time updates of all Task Runs.
example.name: Webhook Endpoint

destination_url.title: Destination Url
destination_url.description: The URL where Task Run result will be forwarded. Must be a valid HTTPS URL.

name.title: Name
name.description: A descriptive name for the Task Forwarder.

description.title: Description
description.description: Additional details about the Task Forwarder's purpose or configuration.

config.description: Configuration parameters for the Task Forwarder such as a `destination` URL.

config_sensitive.description: Sensitive parameters for the Task Forwarder such as a `signing_key`.

example.description: Send all Task output to this API endpoint to ensure real-time updates of all Task Runs.
example.name: Webhook Endpoint

signing_key.title: Signing Key
signing_key.description: A secret key used to sign the forwarded data for verification purposes.

name.title: Name
name.description: A descriptive name for the Task Forwarder.

description.title: Description
description.description: Additional details about the Task Forwarder's purpose or configuration.

config.description: Configuration parameters for the Task Forwarder such as a `destination` URL.

config_sensitive.description: Sensitive parameters for the Task Forwarder such as a `signing_key`.

add.title: Add
add.description:
A list of task roles to grant to the member.

Roles in this list are applied to the member AFTER any removals specified in `remove`.

This may be combined with `remove_all` to replace the member's entire role list.

remove.title: Remove
remove.description: A list of task roles to revoke from the member.

remove_all.title: Remove All
remove_all.description: Removes all existing roles from the member. This may be combined with `add` to replace all existing roles that the member holds.

permissions.title: Permissions
permissions.description: A list of permissions to test on the task.

temperature.title: Temperature
temperature.description: Controls randomness in the output. Lower values make the output more focused and deterministic, while higher values make it more creative and diverse.

id.description: The unique identifier of the Revision.

active.title: Active

match.description: True if the provided description is a close match

example.system_prompt: You are an expert software program specifically designed for the fintech industry that will be used for pre-triage tasks to ensure the best possible client UX and efficient 3rd party platform interoperability.
example.user_prompt: Your task is to validate the uploaded image and determine whether it will be suitable for authentication and onboarding checks. If the image of the person is clear and typical of a passport style photo then set the compliance field to true. Provide rationale for your decision in the rationale field. If the compliance result is false, then provide a helpful hint for the customer who has submitted the photo informing them why it is unacceptable and some steps to remedy it, place this into the hint field. task_revision_id.title: Task Revision Id
task_revision_id.description: The unique identifier of the Task Revision associated with this run.

response.title: Response
response.description: The structured response from the Task execution.

run_data.title: Run Data
run_data.description: Additional data about the Task run, including audit information and submitted input.

id.title: Id
id.description: The unique identifier of the Task Run.

created.title: Created
created.description: The timestamp when the Task Run was created.

response.hint: The image is not suitable for authentication and onboarding checks. Please ensure the photo is a clear, passport-style image with a plain background, good lighting, and no accessories like sunglasses.
response.rationale: The image does not meet the requirements for a passport-style photo. The person is wearing sunglasses, and the background is not plain.
